feed.title: Mother Language Day on web.dev
feed.subtitle: February 21st is International Mother Language Day! To celebrate, each week we’ll be releasing a new video hosted by one of our team members in their mother language.

entry.title: Core Web Vitals best practices (Italian with English subtitles)

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.

This video introduces Core Web Vitals, which are essential metrics to measure the health of a site.
This video covers the Core Web Vitals metrics description including all metrics best practices.
In addition to this the video also covers Tools to measure sites performance overall from Field to Lab environments.

To learn more about Core Web Vitals, check out these resources:
Web Vitals Initiative → https://goo.gle/3gKe8cw
LCP metric best practices → https://goo.gle/2TV8JJN
CLS metric best practices → https://goo.gle/3fxu6IE
FID metric best practices → https://goo.gle/3Ci0xEN
Core Web Vitals & Page Experience FAQs → https://goo.gle/2Ux6SuO

Read more about our International Mother Language Day celebration series → http://goo.gle/mother-language-day-2021
Watch more from the Mother Language Day event → https://goo.gle/369nhI8

Check out more Supercharged Micro Tips → http://goo.gle/3uchv3C
Subscribe to Chrome Developers → https://goo.gle/ChromeDevs
#MotherLanguageDay #ChromeDevelopers

entry.title: 5 tips for your Progressive Web App (Chinese with English subtitles)

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.

Progressive Web Apps make it possible to create web apps that look and behave like every other installed app on a user's desktop or mobile device. We take a look at five easy improvements that you can do to take your PWA even further to provide an experience that feels more integrated and natural for your users. We also show you how to measure the effectiveness of your investments.

Read more about our International Mother Language Day celebration series → http://goo.gle/mother-language-day-2021
Watch more from the Mother Language Day event → https://goo.gle/369nhI8

Check out more Supercharged Micro Tips → http://goo.gle/3uchv3C
Subscribe to Chrome Developers → https://goo.gle/ChromeDevs
#MotherLanguageDay #ChromeDevelopers

entry.title: Improving CLS by optimizing ad delivery (French with English subtitles)

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.

Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) is a user-center metric that quantifies the degree of visual stability in a web page. It is part of the Core Web Vitals, an initiative led by Google to provide guidelines that protect the user experience on the web.

When a page is unstable and CLS is high, ads are often the main culprit. This video will give you tips on how to optimise ad delivery so that users don’t suffer from unexpected layout shifts when ads are served.

Core Web Vitals → https://goo.gle/3gKe8cw
Cumulative Layout Shift → https://goo.gle/3kle3AW

Read more about our International Mother Language Day celebration series → http://goo.gle/mother-language-day-2021
Watch more from the Mother Language Day event → https://goo.gle/369nhI8

Check out more Supercharged Micro Tips → http://goo.gle/3uchv3C
Subscribe to Chrome Developers → https://goo.gle/ChromeDevs
#MotherLanguageDay #ChromeDevelopers

entry.title: Introduction to Web Stories (Swiss German with English subtitles)

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.

Web Stories bring the popular, immersive storytelling format to your own website, where you maintain full control over the experience and monetization. Pascal Birchler, Developer Relations Engineer at Google, explains what Web Stories are, how to create stories, and how you as an online marketer, blogger, or site owner, can make the most out of them.

Web Stories bringen visuelles Storytelling auf deine eigene Website und damit auch neue Möglichkeiten für Benutzerfreundlichkeit und Monetarisierung. Pascal Birchler erklärt für einmal komplett auf Schweizerdeutsch, wie man von diesem neuen Format profitieren und das meiste rausholen kann.

Web Stories on Google - http://goo.gle/stories_google
Enable Web Stories on Google → https://goo.gle/31ypeMk
SEO: How to make your Web Stories visible on the web (Storytime #10) → https://goo.gle/2QU8hK3
Web Stories Test Tool → https://goo.gle/2QSWADt
Analytics for your Web Stories → https://goo.gle/3cxpstg

Read more about our International Mother Language Day celebration series → http://goo.gle/mother-language-day-2021
Watch more from the Mother Language Day event → https://goo.gle/369nhI8

Check out more Supercharged Micro Tips → http://goo.gle/3uchv3C

entry.title: A good cookie recipe (French with English subtitles)

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.

Cookies are everywhere. Setting a cookie can take just one line of code, but there are many ways to configure cookies, some better than others. Learn the best practices for your first-party cookie—and how you can prepare for a more private web if you're using third-party cookies.
Detailed cookie recipes by Rowan Merewood → https://goo.gle/3jA1t0m

entry.title: Core Web Vitals: An everyday explanation (Taiwanese with English subtitles)

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.

Core Web Vitals are meant to measure user experience of actual real-world users during page load. In this talk, we use an everyday explanation of eating out with friends to describe the delays and disruptions that the vitals are meant to assess.

To learn more about Core Web Vitals, check out these resources:
Web Vitals Initiative → https://goo.gle/3gKe8cw
Core Web Vitals & Page Experience FAQs → https://goo.gle/2Ux6SuO
Read more about our International Mother Language Day celebration series → http://goo.gle/mother-language-day-2021

Check out more Supercharged Micro Tips → http://goo.gle/3uchv3C
Subscribe to Chrome Developers → https://goo.gle/ChromeDevs
#MotherLanguageDay #ChromeDevelopers

entry.title: What is the state of web frameworks in India (Hindi with English subtitles)

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.

This video deep dives into the state of different Javascript Frameworks like React, Vue and AngularJS, talking about their market share globally and running a competitive analysis of how they are performing amongst Indian websites when measured against Core Web Vitals using the Real User Metrics (RUM).

entry.title: Advanced patterns for Progressive Web Apps (Spanish with English subtitles)

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.
Learn advanced Progressive Web App recipes that combine several modern web APIs, and how companies are using them to create app-like experiences on their sites.
Aprende patrones avanzados para Progressive Web Apps, que combinan distintas APIs de la web moderna y cómo distintas compañías los están usando en sus sitios.

entry.title: Deep dive into the PWA install flow

content.p: How does the install flow work for Progressive Web Apps? How can you provide your own in-app install experience? How do you measure the effectiveness of your install? And what best practices should you be following?

Installability is one of the biggest advantages of a Progressive Web App. Installing your PWA can make it easier for users to find and use. Once installed, it looks and behaves like every other installed app that the user has. And, they don’t have to go to an app store to get it, there’s no sketchy files to run, and nothing to download.

Customize install → https://goo.gle/3imwOmu
Promote install → https://goo.gle/3pk1lmM

Check out more Supercharged Micro Tips → http://goo.gle/3uchv3C
Subscribe to Chrome Developers → https://goo.gle/ChromeDevs
#ChromeDevelopers

entry.title: Web Audio API 드럼머신 만들기 (Korean with English subtitles)

content.p: Can a web page be a musical instrument? Using the Web Audio API, it can!
In this short video, we'll build a simple drum machine, and show you the core concepts behind the Web Audio API, including routing, adding sound effects and more!

Code examples and audio samples for this tutorial → https://goo.gle/3fVsWq6
Google I/O 2019 “Sonic Boom! Audio Programming on Android and Chrome” → https://goo.gle/2SwLQeT

entry.title: Tipps fuer die Suchmaschinenoptimierung von JavaScript Webseiten (German with English subtitles)

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.

Today, we want to address the main cause of search engine optimization, fear of failure and first of all, what is actually going on when we have JavaScript driven websites? Found out on today’s episode for the International Mother Language Day celebration series.

entry.title: What are PWAs (Spanish with English subtitles)

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.

English:
Using a single code base you might enjoy the big reach of the web as well as the rich capabilities of native apps, implementing a progressive web app. This video explains what a progressive web app is and the basic components you’ll need to create your own in Spanish as a celebration for mother language day

Spanish
Es posible que con un único repositorio de código consigamos el amplio alcance del web así como atractivas funcionalidades de aplicaciones nativas, implementando una aplicación web progressiva (PWA). Este video ofrece una explicación de que es una PWA y los componentes básicos necesarios para crearlas en Español como celebración del día internacional de la lengua materna.

More PWA info → https://goo.gle/3b1lBUc
Workbox → https://goo.gle/3tjVYEr
Read more about our International Mother Language Day celebration series → http://goo.gle/mother-language-day-2021
Subscribe to Chrome Developers → https://goo.gle/ChromeDevs
#MotherLanguageDay #ChromeDevelopers

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.

entry.title: Back/forward cache (Indonesian with English subtitles)

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.

Back/forward cache (or BFcache) is a browser optimization that enables instant back and forward navigation. It significantly improves the browsing experience for users—especially those with slower networks or devices. This video explains what it is, how it might affect your webpages, and how to ensure your webpages are optimized for it. This video is in Bahasa Indonesia with English subtitles.

Back/forward cache (atau BFcache) adalah optimisasi browser yang membuat back dan forward navigation instan mungkin. BFCache membuat browsing jadi jauh lebih baik—terutama untuk pengguna dengan jaringan internet atau device yang lambat. Video ini menjelaskan apa itu BFCache, bagaimana BFCache mempengaruhi halaman web, dan bagaimana kamu bisa menjamin halaman web kamu ter-optimize untuk BFCache. Video ini menggunakan Bahasa Indonesia dengan subtitle Bahasa Inggris.

Back/forward cache web.dev article → https://goo.gle/3dIY3oA
BFCache opt-out spec issue → https://goo.gle/3awG82I
Read more about our International Mother Language Day celebration series → http://goo.gle/mother-language-day-2021
Subscribe to Chrome Developers → https://goo.gle/ChromeDevs
#MotherLanguageDay #ChromeDevelopers

entry.title: Building for modern browsers: Progressively enhancing like it’s 2003 (German with English subtitles)

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.

In this video, I use the Lokalschriftartenzugriffsapplikationsprogrammierschnittstelle (Local Font Access API) to explain how new browser APIs can be used as progressive enhancement and where these APIs developed in the context of Project Fugu come from. Starting with the Web Incubator Community Group (WICG), over to the experimental implementation in Chrome, to final standardization in the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C).

JS Paint → https://goo.gle/2OaxqPz
Local Font Access API → https://goo.gle/2PgtoG8
Local Font Access demo → https://goo.gle/3rGpjb4
Fugu API tracker → https://goo.gle/39xTY4d
Project Fugu articles → https://goo.gle/3fv0kVT
Read more about our International Mother Language Day celebration series → http://goo.gle/mother-language-day-2021
Subscribe to Chrome Developers → https://goo.gle/ChromeDevs
#MotherLanguageDay #ChromeDevelopers #Chrome

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.

entry.title: Core Web Vitals: Essential metrics for a healthy site (Tamil with English subtitles)

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.

This video introduces Core Web Vitals (CWV), which are essential metrics to measure the health of a site. CWV were announced as part of page experience signals which will be included in search ranking starting May 2021. In addition to introducing the concepts, this video points to key resources to learn more about and optimize for Core Web Vitals.
Search announcement about Page Experience and Core Web Vitals → https://goo.gle/3tRG8S1
Learn more about Core Web Vitals → http://goo.gle/webvitals
Read more about our International Mother Language Day celebration series → http://goo.gle/mother-language-day-2021

Check out more Supercharged Micro Tips → http://goo.gle/3uchv3C
Subscribe to Chrome Developers → https://goo.gle/ChromeDevs
#MotherLanguageDay #ChromeDevelopers #CoreWebVitals

entry.title: Core Web Vitals - Measure what matters (Serbian with English subtitles)

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.
One of the biggest challenges with using performance metrics is that there are so many of them and this can make it difficult to decide which to focus on.
Web Vitals is an initiative by Google that seeks to define a set of key performance metrics that capture the page characteristics that make for a good user experience.
Learn more about each Web Vitals metric, what to do to get good Web Vitals scores, and how to measure and continuously monitor them.

Web Vitals overview → http://goo.gle/3cgBbuI
To learn more about Web Vitals → http://goo.gle/2PYe7cT
Read more about our International Mother Language Day celebration series → http://goo.gle/mother-language-day-2021
Subscribe to Chrome Developers → https://goo.gle/ChromeDevs
#MotherLanguageDay #ChromeDevelopers

entry.title: Simulating color vision deficiencies in the Blink Renderer (available in Flemish and English)

content.p: Switch audio to English or Flemish by clicking on the settings wheel and selecting your preferred audio track. Switch on/off English or Flemish subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.

Chrome DevTools can simulate color vision deficiencies in the Blink Renderer, to help you designers & developers understand the accessibility of their color schemes. This presentation explains why we worked on this, how to achieve the same effect using web technology (HTML, CSS, and SVG), and how we actually implemented this in the Blink Renderer (C++)
Read more about our International Mother Language Day celebration series → https://goo.gle/mother-language-day-2021
Subscribe to Chrome Developers → https://goo.gle/ChromeDevs
Presenter: Mathias Bynens https://twitter.com/mathias​
#MotherLanguageDay #ChromeDevelopers

entry.title: Supercharged Microtip: Workers (German with English subtitles)

content.p: Switch on/off English subtitles by clicking on the CC icon.

Surma revives Supercharged for a special episode on Web Workers, the web’s version of threads. Why would you use workers? When are they a good idea and what are the downsides? All of this in this rapid-fire edition of Supercharged.

entry.title: Celebrating International Mother Language Day

content.p: February 21st is International Mother Language Day! To celebrate, each week we’ll be releasing a new video hosted by one of our team members in their mother language.
Read more here: https://developer.chrome.com/blog/mother-language-day-2021
Don’t miss an episode, subscribe to Chrome Developers → https://goo.gle/ChromeDevs
#MotherLanguageDay
